title: Way overrated!
reviews: Despite the hype and the great ambience the food was quite overrated! The meat was too fatty and was not properly cooked to our order. The service was great and the team were super helpful and friendly.

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. When dining don't miss trying the baklava with vanilla ice cream. It's not to be missed and tastes really good. I will keep returning when visiting Istanbul.More

title: MUST VISIT
reviews:
We came here twice because on our first visit we only tried one menu since we are still full from our previous meal. On both visit, we ordered an onion flower, the first one sure tasted better because the second one is very oily I...can feel it on my throat, we didnt finish that. Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

title: dinner twice - once near the Grand Bazar outlet and next at the main Nusret
reviews: Food at the Grand Bazar outlet was wonderful (true to the old Nusret I knew) as was the service - the time and attention and recommendations was so good. The only downside is they dont serve liquor. At the main Nusret, it is a herding...of people - poor service and no time for the guests. One is made to feel lucky to have been given a table and food. The main Nusret I knew from yester years was one of excellent food and service and welcoming. Recommend go to the smaller Nusret outlets - will be very good and usually u will not have to make a reservation though advance reservation is recommended. .More

title: average

title: my experience at the Nusret Resturant
reviews:
it was great and fantastic

title: simply the TASTE

title: Amazing Place
reviews:

Love all dishes , salads , ,sweets
Thanks to Joly and sinan
I like to come back again

title: The taste of the Heaven
reviews:

Every bite is a taste of heaven.

title: Overall good food but Best Baklawa ever
reviews:
I went over lunch and we had shared all the food. The salads were great and the beef was outstanding. The lamb chops were ok. 

But the Baklawa is out of this world. Worth the calories :)

title: Spot on
reviews:

And thankfully I wasn't disappointed the food was great the atmosphere was killer desert was good and the tea to finish things off and adjust your...More

title: Meat, meat and meat!
reviews: If you're looking for a great steak house, you have arrived. The food is fresh and delicious, the service is quick and efficient. Nice venue for groups and family. The ice cream biklawa for dessert is magnificent.

title: 2nd time but not very satisfied

title: Great Meat restaurant !

title: Best stake

title: Taste is great
reviews:
One of the best stake houses i have ever been to. It is comparable with the best stake available in New York.
Dessert and tea is a must after the food.

title: Over evaluated

title: Our for Dinner with the family

nusret is a must

its worth the wait

But watch out, it's not cheap.

title: Slightly below expectations..

title: amazing and fascinating
reviews: It was an amazing experience.The place was highly crowded and we had to Waite for a while even though we made reservations.But at the end we got our table and the food was something extraordinary.

title: Absolutely the Best Meat in Istanbul
reviews:
I have been here on multiple occasions and just love it.  The variety is mind boggling and the taste heavenly.  Get a reservation or be prepared to wait.  The wait is well worth it.

PS You also should ALWAYS eat the baklava for dessert

title: steak in Turkey..
reviews: if you want to have steak in Turkey this is the place.Different steaks ..service is not so good(we were there on a Friday night) but prices are more than fair.

title: Not as good as old times..

title: Best Steakhouse in Turkey

title: Cheater
reviews: They always find a way to cheat the guest either by bringing more than required food or skip some thing that's included in the menu. Be aware

title: PERFECT STEAKHOUSE

title: VERY GOOD

title: Wish I went twice

title: Best burger in Istanbul :)

title: Excellent steak
reviews: This steak house in Istanbul is a must for beef lovers. Menu is not huge but it cover your beef hunger. One of the best steak I have ever had. It's costly resturant but worth to try it. Don't miss the dessert

title: Best steak ever...but at a cost

title: Very popular Restuarant in Istanbul

title: Excellent food but...
reviews: Food and service at this restaurant was excellent but the location and the ambience of the hotel is not romantic at all and not for couples.

title: Still a great place for unforgetable burgers in Istanbul

title: Great food!
reviews: Great food and the service is amazing! Nusret himself was there and he cut the rib order we had! the dessert was just excellent

title: Disaster
reviews:

title: Very good ...but expensive

-you never had a British aged beef

title: Meat, meat and some more meat

title: Best red meat ! But watch and be careful what you order the drinks!
reviews: Greatest steaks in the world. I am a red meat lover and this place has the best ! Service is rather slow, not the politest in the world but quite OK for Istanbul, do not expect incredible fast and friendly service anywhere here and Nusret...More

title: Not to be missed and certainly revisited.
reviews:

Dont go if you are a veggie but for meat lovers it's just amazing!
Meat meat and more meat all of it leaving you wanting more no matter how full you are,
The baklava and the way...More

title: Salty Kebab Burger
reviews:
The tiny restaurant sits on the second floor at a bustling street corner. The handful of tables overlook a beautiful bay teeming with ferries and seagulls. The atmosphere is peaceful yet energetic, and you can sit here for a comfy lunch. 

The menu, however, had...More

title: nusret yalikavak
reviews: worst service ever. very poor food. waited 45 minutes for the table. table not clean.menu list with a lot of specialties but only four were possible to have

title: Not for the vegetarians!!
reviews:
As a frequent visitor to Istanbul for business, this place is always high on my list of dining venues.  Staff are hospitable, service is good to great, and the meat is to die for.

Can get a little busy, and you may need to wait...More

title: Best restaurant
reviews: one of the best restaurants in istanbul...the food was sooo gooood the steak one of the best their salad as well....desert was yummy....

title: what a disgrace
reviews: The prices have doubled up while the quantity  and quality of the food deteriorated. DISAPPOINTED ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡

title: Way overrated!
reviews: Despite the hype and the great ambience the food was quite overrated! The meat was too fatty and was not properly cooked to our order. The service was great and the team were super helpful and friendly.

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. When dining don't miss trying the baklava with vanilla ice cream. It's not to be missed and tastes really good. I will keep returning when visiting Istanbul.More

title: MUST VISIT
reviews:
We came here twice because on our first visit we only tried one menu since we are still full from our previous meal. On both visit, we ordered an onion flower, the first one sure tasted better because the second one is very oily I...can feel it on my throat, we didnt finish that. Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

title: dinner twice - once near the Grand Bazar outlet and next at the main Nusret
reviews: Food at the Grand Bazar outlet was wonderful (true to the old Nusret I knew) as was the service - the time and attention and recommendations was so good. The only downside is they dont serve liquor. At the main Nusret, it is a herding...of people - poor service and no time for the guests. One is made to feel lucky to have been given a table and food. The main Nusret I knew from yester years was one of excellent food and service and welcoming. Recommend go to the smaller Nusret outlets - will be very good and usually u will not have to make a reservation though advance reservation is recommended. .More

title: Steaklovers destination
reviews: My experience at Nusr-et was really good. Nice welcoming, friendly staff. Food made to our liking. The ÅžaÅŸlÄ±k was super tasty and fresh.

reviews:
They make the best hamburger in Istanbul!
Price is not expensive
I would visit it again 
I visit the grand bazar restaurant

This...time I focus  on quality .
My steak was still was good but just good and very expensive for istanbul.
I recommend this restaurant highly for just one visit which is worthy to seeMore

reviews:

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

title: dinner twice - once near the Grand Bazar outlet and next at the main Nusret
reviews: Food at the Grand Bazar outlet was wonderful (true to the old Nusret I knew) as was the service - the time and attention and recommendations was so good. The only downside is they dont serve liquor. At the main Nusret, it is a herding...of people - poor service and no time for the guests. One is made to feel lucky to have been given a table and food. The main Nusret I knew from yester years was one of excellent food and service and welcoming. Recommend go to the smaller Nusret outlets - will be very good and usually u will not have to make a reservation though advance reservation is recommended. .More

title: Excellent for just one try
reviews:

I should confess that the first time was more attractive to me.
First time I went there, the atmosphere and style caught my eye . I had fun and of course the quality of food was good.
This...time I focus  on quality .
My steak was still was good but just good and very expensive for istanbul.
I recommend this restaurant highly for just one visit which is worthy to seeMore

title: Way better than expected!!
reviews:
Although I was afraid that it would be a rather overrated restaurant, it was excellent. The food was delicious, and the service exceptional. It was crowded, but somehow the stuff managed to find a table for everyone in a few minutes.
The meat was great,...and the fried onion the waiter proposed was delicious (definitely try it if you're going).More

title: Real good!
reviews: We had a lovely night out in the city and this restaurant was soo good. It was crowded and full of energy and we really loved it. Definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone.

title: Way overrated!
reviews: Despite the hype and the great ambience the food was quite overrated! The meat was too fatty and was not properly cooked to our order. The service was great and the team were super helpful and friendly.

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. When dining don't miss trying the baklava with vanilla ice cream. It's not to be missed and tastes really good. I will keep returning when visiting Istanbul.More

reviews:

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. When dining don't miss trying the baklava with vanilla ice cream. It's not to be missed and tastes really good. I will keep returning when visiting Istanbul.More

title: MUST VISIT
reviews:
We came here twice because on our first visit we only tried one menu since we are still full from our previous meal. On both visit, we ordered an onion flower, the first one sure tasted better because the second one is very oily I...can feel it on my throat, we didnt finish that. Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. title: MUST VISIT
reviews:
We came here twice because on our first visit we only tried one menu since we are still full from our previous meal. On both visit, we ordered an onion flower, the first one sure tasted better because the second one is very oily I...can feel it on my throat, we didnt finish that. Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

reviews: The prices have doubled up while the quantity  and quality of the food deteriorated. DISAPPOINTED ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡

title: Way overrated!
reviews: Despite the hype and the great ambience the food was quite overrated! The meat was too fatty and was not properly cooked to our order. The service was great and the team were super helpful and friendly.

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. When dining don't miss trying the baklava with vanilla ice cream. It's not to be missed and tastes really good. I will keep returning when visiting Istanbul.More

title: MUST VISIT
reviews:
We came here twice because on our first visit we only tried one menu since we are still full from our previous meal. On both visit, we ordered an onion flower, the first one sure tasted better because the second one is very oily I...can feel it on my throat, we didnt finish that. Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

title: dinner twice - once near the Grand Bazar outlet and next at the main Nusret
reviews: Food at the Grand Bazar outlet was wonderful (true to the old Nusret I knew) as was the service - the time and attention and recommendations was so good. The only downside is they dont serve liquor. At the main Nusret, it is a herding...of people - poor service and no time for the guests. One is made to feel lucky to have been given a table and food. The main Nusret I knew from yester years was one of excellent food and service and welcoming. Recommend go to the smaller Nusret outlets - will be very good and usually u will not have to make a reservation though advance reservation is recommended. .More

title: Excellent for just one try
reviews:
It was my second time in Nusret.
I should confess that the first time was more attractive to me.
First time I went there, the atmosphere and style caught my eye . I had fun and of course the quality of food was good.
This...time I focus  on quality .
My steak was still was good but just good and very expensive for istanbul.
I recommend this restaurant highly for just one visit which is worthy to seeMore

title: Way better than expected!!
reviews:
Although I was afraid that it would be a rather overrated restaurant, it was excellent. The food was delicious, and the service exceptional. It was crowded, but somehow the stuff managed to find a table for everyone in a few minutes.
The meat was great,...and the fried onion the waiter proposed was delicious (definitely try it if you're going).More

We came here twice because on our first visit we only tried one menu since we are still full from our previous meal. On both visit, we ordered an onion flower, the first one sure tasted better because the second one is very oily I...can feel it on my throat, we didnt finish that. Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

title: dinner twice - once near the Grand Bazar outlet and next at the main Nusret
reviews: Food at the Grand Bazar outlet was wonderful (true to the old Nusret I knew) as was the service - the time and attention and recommendations was so good. The only downside is they dont serve liquor. At the main Nusret, it is a herding...of people - poor service and no time for the guests. One is made to feel lucky to have been given a table and food. The main Nusret I knew from yester years was one of excellent food and service and welcoming. Recommend go to the smaller Nusret outlets - will be very good and usually u will not have to make a reservation though advance reservation is recommended. .More

title: Steaklovers destination
reviews: My experience at Nusr-et was really good. Nice welcoming, friendly staff. Food made to our liking. The ÅžaÅŸlÄ±k was super tasty and fresh.

title: Tasty!!! Delicious!!!
reviews:
They make the best hamburger in Istanbul!
Price is not expensive
I would visit it again 
I visit the grand bazar restaurant

title: Excellent for just one try
reviews:
It was my second time in Nusret.
I should confess that the first time was more attractive to me.
First time I went there, the atmosphere and style caught my eye . I had fun and of course the quality of food was good.
This...time I focus  on quality .
My steak was still was good but just good and very expensive for istanbul.
I recommend this restaurant highly for just one visit which is worthy to seeMore

title: Way better than expected!!
reviews:
Although I was afraid that it would be a rather overrated restaurant, it was excellent. The food was delicious, and the service exceptional. It was crowded, but somehow the stuff managed to find a table for everyone in a few minutes.
The meat was great,...and the fried onion the waiter proposed was delicious (definitely try it if you're going).More

title: Real good!
reviews: We had a lovely night out in the city and this restaurant was soo good. It was crowded and full of energy and we really loved it. Definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone.

title: what a disgrace
reviews: The prices have doubled up while the quantity  and quality of the food deteriorated. DISAPPOINTED ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡

title: Way overrated!
reviews: Despite the hype and the great ambience the food was quite overrated! The meat was too fatty and was not properly cooked to our order. The service was great and the team were super helpful and friendly.

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. When dining don't miss trying the baklava with vanilla ice cream. It's not to be missed and tastes really good. I will keep returning when visiting Istanbul.More

I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

The main Nusret I knew from yester years was one of excellent food and service and welcoming. Recommend go to the smaller Nusret outlets - will be very good and usually u will not have to make a reservation though advance reservation is recommended. .More

title: Excellent for just one try
reviews:
It was my second time in Nusret.
I should confess that the first time was more attractive to me.
First time I went there, the atmosphere and style caught my eye . I had fun and of course the quality of food was good.
This...time I focus  on quality .
My steak was still was good but just good and very expensive for istanbul.
I recommend this restaurant highly for just one visit which is worthy to seeMore

title: Way better than expected!!
reviews:
Although I was afraid that it would be a rather overrated restaurant, it was excellent. The food was delicious, and the service exceptional. It was crowded, but somehow the stuff managed to find a table for everyone in a few minutes.
The meat was great,...and the fried onion the waiter proposed was delicious (definitely try it if you're going).More

title: Real good!
reviews: We had a lovely night out in the city and this restaurant was soo good. It was crowded and full of energy and we really loved it. Definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone.

title: what a disgrace
reviews: The prices have doubled up while the quantity  and quality of the food deteriorated. DISAPPOINTED ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡

title: Way overrated!
reviews: Despite the hype and the great ambience the food was quite overrated! The meat was too fatty and was not properly cooked to our order. The service was great and the team were super helpful and friendly.

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. When dining don't miss trying the baklava with vanilla ice cream. It's not to be missed and tastes really good. I will keep returning when visiting Istanbul.More

title: MUST VISIT
reviews:
We came here twice because on our first visit we only tried one menu since we are still full from our previous meal. On both visit, we ordered an onion flower, the first one sure tasted better because the second one is very oily I...can feel it on my throat, we didnt finish that. Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

My steak was still was good but just good and very expensive for istanbul.
I recommend this restaurant highly for just one visit which is worthy to seeMore

title: Way better than expected!!
reviews:
Although I was afraid that it would be a rather overrated restaurant, it was excellent. The food was delicious, and the service exceptional. It was crowded, but somehow the stuff managed to find a table for everyone in a few minutes.

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. When dining don't miss trying the baklava with vanilla ice cream. It's not to be missed and tastes really good. I will keep returning when visiting Istanbul.More

title: MUST VISIT
reviews:
We came here twice because on our first visit we only tried one menu since we are still full from our previous meal. On both visit, we ordered an onion flower, the first one sure tasted better because the second one is very oily I...can feel it on my throat, we didnt finish that. Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

title: dinner twice - once near the Grand Bazar outlet and next at the main Nusret

reviews: Despite the hype and the great ambience the food was quite overrated! The meat was too fatty and was not properly cooked to our order. The service was great and the team were super helpful and friendly.

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. When dining don't miss trying the baklava with vanilla ice cream. It's not to be missed and tastes really good. I will keep returning when visiting Istanbul.More

title: MUST VISIT
reviews:
We came here twice because on our first visit we only tried one menu since we are still full from our previous meal. On both visit, we ordered an onion flower, the first one sure tasted better because the second one is very oily I...can feel it on my throat, we didnt finish that. Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

title: dinner twice - once near the Grand Bazar outlet and next at the main Nusret
reviews: Food at the Grand Bazar outlet was wonderful (true to the old Nusret I knew) as was the service - the time and attention and recommendations was so good. The only downside is they dont serve liquor. At the main Nusret, it is a herding...of people - poor service and no time for the guests. One is made to feel lucky to have been given a table and food. The main Nusret I knew from yester years was one of excellent food and service and welcoming. Recommend go to the smaller Nusret outlets - will be very good and usually u will not have to make a reservation though advance reservation is recommended. .More

title: Excellent for just one try
reviews:
It was my second time in Nusret.
I should confess that the first time was more attractive to me.
First time I went there, the atmosphere and style caught my eye . I had fun and of course the quality of food was good.
This...time I focus  on quality .
My steak was still was good but just good and very expensive for istanbul.
I recommend this restaurant highly for just one visit which is worthy to seeMore

title: Way better than expected!!
reviews:
Although I was afraid that it would be a rather overrated restaurant, it was excellent. The food was delicious, and the service exceptional. It was crowded, but somehow the stuff managed to find a table for everyone in a few minutes.
The meat was great,...and the fried onion the waiter proposed was delicious (definitely try it if you're going).More

Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

title: dinner twice - once near the Grand Bazar outlet and next at the main Nusret
reviews: Food at the Grand Bazar outlet was wonderful (true to the old Nusret I knew) as was the service - the time and attention and recommendations was so good. The only downside is they dont serve liquor. At the main Nusret, it is a herding...of people - poor service and no time for the guests. One is made to feel lucky to have been given a table and food. The main Nusret I knew from yester years was one of excellent food and service and welcoming. Recommend go to the smaller Nusret outlets - will be very good and usually u will not have to make a reservation though advance reservation is recommended. .More

I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

The main Nusret I knew from yester years was one of excellent food and service and welcoming. Recommend go to the smaller Nusret outlets - will be very good and usually u will not have to make a reservation though advance reservation is recommended. .More

title: Excellent for just one try
reviews:
It was my second time in Nusret.
I should confess that the first time was more attractive to me.
First time I went there, the atmosphere and style caught my eye . I had fun and of course the quality of food was good.
This...time I focus  on quality .
My steak was still was good but just good and very expensive for istanbul.
I recommend this restaurant highly for just one visit which is worthy to seeMore

title: Way better than expected!!
reviews:
Although I was afraid that it would be a rather overrated restaurant, it was excellent. The food was delicious, and the service exceptional. It was crowded, but somehow the stuff managed to find a table for everyone in a few minutes.
The meat was great,...and the fried onion the waiter proposed was delicious (definitely try it if you're going).More

title: Real good!
reviews: We had a lovely night out in the city and this restaurant was soo good. It was crowded and full of energy and we really loved it. Definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone.

title: what a disgrace
reviews: The prices have doubled up while the quantity  and quality of the food deteriorated. DISAPPOINTED ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡

title: Way overrated!
reviews: Despite the hype and the great ambience the food was quite overrated! The meat was too fatty and was not properly cooked to our order. The service was great and the team were super helpful and friendly.

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. When dining don't miss trying the baklava with vanilla ice cream. It's not to be missed and tastes really good. I will keep returning when visiting Istanbul.More

title: MUST VISIT
reviews:
We came here twice because on our first visit we only tried one menu since we are still full from our previous meal. On both visit, we ordered an onion flower, the first one sure tasted better because the second one is very oily I...can feel it on my throat, we didnt finish that. Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

My steak was still was good but just good and very expensive for istanbul.
I recommend this restaurant highly for just one visit which is worthy to seeMore

title: Way better than expected!!
reviews:
Although I was afraid that it would be a rather overrated restaurant, it was excellent. The food was delicious, and the service exceptional. It was crowded, but somehow the stuff managed to find a table for everyone in a few minutes.

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. When dining don't miss trying the baklava with vanilla ice cream. It's not to be missed and tastes really good. I will keep returning when visiting Istanbul.More

title: MUST VISIT
reviews:
We came here twice because on our first visit we only tried one menu since we are still full from our previous meal. On both visit, we ordered an onion flower, the first one sure tasted better because the second one is very oily I...can feel it on my throat, we didnt finish that. Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

title: dinner twice - once near the Grand Bazar outlet and next at the main Nusret

reviews: Despite the hype and the great ambience the food was quite overrated! The meat was too fatty and was not properly cooked to our order. The service was great and the team were super helpful and friendly.

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. When dining don't miss trying the baklava with vanilla ice cream. It's not to be missed and tastes really good. I will keep returning when visiting Istanbul.More

title: MUST VISIT
reviews:
We came here twice because on our first visit we only tried one menu since we are still full from our previous meal. On both visit, we ordered an onion flower, the first one sure tasted better because the second one is very oily I...can feel it on my throat, we didnt finish that. Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

title: dinner twice - once near the Grand Bazar outlet and next at the main Nusret
reviews: Food at the Grand Bazar outlet was wonderful (true to the old Nusret I knew) as was the service - the time and attention and recommendations was so good. The only downside is they dont serve liquor. At the main Nusret, it is a herding...of people - poor service and no time for the guests. One is made to feel lucky to have been given a table and food. The main Nusret I knew from yester years was one of excellent food and service and welcoming. Recommend go to the smaller Nusret outlets - will be very good and usually u will not have to make a reservation though advance reservation is recommended. .More

title: Excellent for just one try
reviews:
It was my second time in Nusret.
I should confess that the first time was more attractive to me.
First time I went there, the atmosphere and style caught my eye . I had fun and of course the quality of food was good.
This...time I focus  on quality .
My steak was still was good but just good and very expensive for istanbul.
I recommend this restaurant highly for just one visit which is worthy to seeMore

title: Way better than expected!!
reviews:
Although I was afraid that it would be a rather overrated restaurant, it was excellent. The food was delicious, and the service exceptional. It was crowded, but somehow the stuff managed to find a table for everyone in a few minutes.
The meat was great,...and the fried onion the waiter proposed was delicious (definitely try it if you're going).More

Moving on, overall we tried three courses:
1. Kuzu kafes (lamb) --> you got the slicing show if u order this 
2. Dana kaburga
3. Nusret special (if im not mistaken)

I think dana kaburga and nusret special are my two favs and will def order again if i come back to turkey. Both meet are SUPER SOFT, i didnt even use the knife to cut it!! But I think my best choice would be the nusret special because it is less oily and how its mixed with the bread and the smell of the butter is a perfect combination!! Also, I saw a lot of people ordering it so it must be one of their specials. of course we closed our meal with baklava!! this is my fav baklava out of many baklavas i tried in turkey, combined with the ice cream ugh so good and fresh!! I went there twice (weekdays tho) and no queue (the place is huge, the one near grand bazar)!! Plus value because the waiters are handy and fast so your table will not be dirty. 

I def recommend everyone to try this!! i think the price is still reasonable (they have variety of price) considering how good the food is and the overall experience.More

title: dinner twice - once near the Grand Bazar outlet and next at the main Nusret
reviews: Food at the Grand Bazar outlet was wonderful (true to the old Nusret I knew) as was the service - the time and attention and recommendations was so good. The only downside is they dont serve liquor. At the main Nusret, it is a herding...of people - poor service and no time for the guests. One is made to feel lucky to have been given a table and food. The main Nusret I knew from yester years was one of excellent food and service and welcoming. Recommend go to the smaller Nusret outlets - will be very good and usually u will not have to make a reservation though advance reservation is recommended. .More

title: Steaklovers destination
reviews: My experience at Nusr-et was really good. Nice welcoming, friendly staff. Food made to our liking. The ÅžaÅŸlÄ±k was super tasty and fresh.

title: Tasty!!! Delicious!!!
reviews:
They make the best hamburger in Istanbul!
Price is not expensive
I would visit it again 
I visit the grand bazar restaurant

title: Excellent for just one try
reviews:
It was my second time in Nusret.
I should confess that the first time was more attractive to me.
First time I went there, the atmosphere and style caught my eye . I had fun and of course the quality of food was good.
This...time I focus  on quality .
My steak was still was good but just good and very expensive for istanbul.
I recommend this restaurant highly for just one visit which is worthy to seeMore

title: Way better than expected!!
reviews:
Although I was afraid that it would be a rather overrated restaurant, it was excellent. The food was delicious, and the service exceptional. It was crowded, but somehow the stuff managed to find a table for everyone in a few minutes.
The meat was great,...and the fried onion the waiter proposed was delicious (definitely try it if you're going).More

title: Real good!
reviews: We had a lovely night out in the city and this restaurant was soo good. It was crowded and full of energy and we really loved it. Definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone.

title: what a disgrace
reviews: The prices have doubled up while the quantity  and quality of the food deteriorated. DISAPPOINTED ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡

title: Way overrated!
reviews: Despite the hype and the great ambience the food was quite overrated! The meat was too fatty and was not properly cooked to our order. The service was great and the team were super helpful and friendly.

title: Great Dining Experience
reviews: I have visited Nusret inside the Grand Bazaar and also at the main location in Istanbul. Each time I have visited these restaurants I have never left disappointed. We have tried the lamb chops with fries, a steak dish, a hamburger, salad, etc. Everything has...always tasted fresh and the service is very good. When dining don't miss trying the baklava with vanilla ice cream. It's not to be missed and tastes really good. I will keep returning when visiting Istanbul.More
